Package com.behreajj.camzup.core

Class Lab

java.lang.Object
com.behreajj.camzup.core.Lab
All Implemented Interfaces:
IColor, Comparable<IColor>
public class Lab extends Object implements IColor
A mutable, extensible color class that represents colors in a perceptual color space, such as CIE LAB, SR LAB 2 or OK LAB. The a and b axes are signed, unbounded values. Negative a indicates a green hue; positive, magenta. Negative b indicates a blue hue; positive, yellow. Lightness falls in the range [0.0, 100.0]. For a and b, the practical range is roughly [-111.0, 111.0]. Alpha is expected to be in [0.0, 1.0] .

  • Constructor Details

    • Lab

      public Lab()
      The default constructor. Creates a white color.

    • Lab

      public Lab(byte l, byte a, byte b)
      Creates a color from bytes. In Java, bytes are signed, within the range [0x80, 0x7f]. The alpha channel defaults to 1.0.
      Parameters:
      l - the light component
      a - the green-magenta component
      b - the blue-yellow component

    • dist

      public static float dist(Lab o, Lab d)
      Finds the distance between two colors. Uses the Euclidean distance of a and b and the Manhattan distance for l and alpha. Alpha is scaled by 100.0.
      Parameters:
      o - the left operand
      d - the right operand
      Returns:
      the distance

    • dist

      public static float dist(Lab o, Lab d, float alphaScalar)
      Finds the distance between two colors. Uses the Euclidean distance of a and b and the Manhattan distance for l and alpha. Alpha is scaled by 100.0. Since the alpha range is less than that of the other channels, a scalar is provided to increase its weight.
      Parameters:
      o - the left operand
      d - the right operand
      alphaScalar - the alpha scalar
      Returns:
      the distance
      See Also:
      • Math.abs(double)
      • Math.sqrt(double)

    • grid

      public static Lab[][][] grid(int cols, int rows, int layers)
      Generates a 3D array of colors. The result is in layer-row-major order, but the parameters are supplied in reverse: columns first, then rows, then layers.

      cols - number of columns
      rows - number of rows
      layers - number of layers

    • hueBetween

      public static float hueBetween(Lab o, Lab d)
      Finds the hue distance between two colors. When either color is gray, returns 0.0. Otherwise, returns a value in the range [0.0, 0.5].
      Parameters:
      o - the first color
      d - the second color
      Returns:
      hue distance
      See Also:
      • Math.acos(double)

    • random

      public static Lab random(Random rng, Lab target)
      Creates a random color. The light bounds are [5.0f, 95.0f]. The a axis bounds are [-82.95598602294922f, 104.49945831298828f]. The b axis bounds are [-110.80780029296875f, 95.1866226196289f]. The alpha channel defaults to 1.0 .
      Parameters:
      rng - the random number generator
      target - the output color
      Returns:
      the random color

      upperBound - the upper bound
      target - the output color
      Returns:
      the random color

    • rescaleChroma

      public static Lab rescaleChroma(Lab o, float scalar, Lab target)
      Normalizes the color's a and b components, then multiplies by a scalar, in effect setting the color's chroma. If the source chroma is near zero, then returns the gray color.
      Parameters:
      o - the source color
      scalar - the scalar
      target - the output color
      Returns:
      the scaled chroma color
      See Also:
      • Math.sqrt(double)
      • gray(Lab, Lab)

    • grid

      protected static Lab[][][] grid(int cols, int rows, int layers, float lbl, float lba, float lbb, float ubl, float uba, float ubb, float alpha)
      Generates a 3D array of vectors. The result is in layer-row-major order, but the parameters are supplied in reverse: columns first, then rows, then layers.

      This is separated to make overriding the public grid functions easier. This is protected because it is too easy for integers to be quietly promoted to floats if the signature parameters are confused.
      Parameters:
      cols - number of columns
      rows - number of rows
      layers - number of layers
      lbl - lower bound l
      lba - lower bound a
      lbb - lower bound b
      ubl - upper bound l
      uba - upper bound a
      ubb - upper bound b
      alpha - the alpha channel
      Returns:
      the array

    • set

      public Lab set(byte l, byte a, byte b)
      Sets a color with bytes. In Java, bytes are signed, within the range [0x80, 0x7f]. The alpha channel defaults to 1.0.
      Parameters:
      l - the light component
      a - the green-magenta component
      b - the blue-yellow component
      Returns:
      this color

    • toHexInt

      public int toHexInt()
      Converts a color to a 32-bit integer where hexadecimal represents the color components as 0xTTLLAABB, T being alpha. Defaults to modular arithmetic.
      Specified by:
      toHexInt in interface IColor
      Returns:
      the color in hexadecimal

    • toHexIntSat

      public int toHexIntSat()
      Converts a color to a 32-bit integer where hexadecimal represents the color components as 0xTTLLAABB, T being alpha. Uses saturation arithmetic, i.e., clamps the a and b components to [-127.5, 127.5], floors, then and adds 128. Scales lightness from [0.0, 100.0] to [0, 255]. Scales alpha from [0.0, 1.0] to [0, 255].
      Specified by:
      toHexIntSat in interface IColor
      Returns:
      the color in hexadecimal
      See Also:
      • Utils.clamp(float, float, float)
      • Utils.clamp01(float)
      • Utils.floor(float)

    • toHexIntWrap

      public int toHexIntWrap()
      Converts a color to a 32-bit integer where hexadecimal represents the color components as 0xTTLLAABB, T being alpha. Uses modular arithmetic. Scales lightness from [0.0, 100.0] to [0, 255]. Scales alpha from [0.0, 1.0] to [0, 255]. Assumes a and b are in [-127.5, 127.5]; adds 128 to each.
      Specified by:
      toHexIntWrap in interface IColor
      Returns:
      the color in hexadecimal
      See Also:
      • Utils.floor(float)

      the color in hexadecimal
